title: Brief stop to watch surfers on a reverse wave flow
text: During a bike ride we stopped at this location just outside the English Gardens. Unique surfing opportunity on reverse wave ride. The flow was pretty strong and there were at least 6 surfers that took their time riding the waves, with some doing some nifty tricks. You don't need much more than 10-15 minutes to see what they are doing.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Watching surfers at the Eisbach Wave
text: On the southern end of the English Gardens is this artificial streams flowing underneath a bridge near the Haus der Kunst museum. The fast flowing water forms a wave and surfers line up along the bank either side of the banks, taking turns to enter the water with their boards. A really offbeat thing to watch in the middle of a city.A real hidden gem in Munich.

title: Surfs Up
text: Head into the English gardens and check out the action. No, not the beer drinking, no not feeding the ducks, no not bicycle riding, ah yes watching the surfer dudes and dudettes  surf the ripping standing wave. Great viewing spots on both sides as the surfers stay in one spot on an undulating wave doing tricks. Very cool for the viewers and even more cool for the surfers as they crash and burn into the cold water. Great photo and video action.
